Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient has been feeling okay but is busy with work and family responsibilities.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has reflected on arguments with friends and is working on being more proactive in handling disagreements.
Psychosocial History: The patient has been managing multiple responsibilities and is actively reflecting on personal interactions.
Risk Assessment: The patient feels anxious about expressing feelings and worries about others' reactions.
Mental Health Observations: The patient feels more in control when pausing before reacting, although it is challenging.
Progress Evaluation: The patient has received positive feedback from friends about appearing calmer and has successfully navigated disagreements through listening and compromise.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is open to practicing mindfulness and breathing exercises to manage anxiety.
Next Steps: The patient plans to express feelings more clearly in conversations and is considering getting another pet in a few months while ensuring readiness.
